title: Love Island Australia host Sophie Monk sports mullet in throwback photos
text:
Sophie Monk is a familiar face on Australian TV thanks to her stint as The Bachelorette and her regular hosting role on Love Island.

But her rise to fame began almost two decades ago when she applied for the 2000 talent show Popstars - and her look has certainly changed a lot since then.

In resurfaced photos from a pop music festival in 2002, Sophie, now 39, rocked a bold mullet hairstyle with bangs as she performed on stage.

My, how you've changed! Love Island host Sophie Monk takes to the stage with a MULLET and wearing a tiny denim skirt in rare throwback photos (left). Pictured right: Sophie in July 2019

In the photos, Sophie's blonde locks were teased on top of her head in a messy rock-chick look.

She was performing on stage as a solo act at the Rumba Festival in Sydney, just a few months after splitting from girl band Bardot.

Adding to her edgy look, Sophie wore dark eye makeup and a racy ensemble.

Sophie's mullet moment! Sophie, now 39, rocked a bold mullet hairstyle with bangs in 2002 as she performed at the Rumba Festival in Sydney

Sophie sported knee-high boots with fishnet stockings and a micro denim skirt that left little to the imagination.

She was flanked by shirtless hunks on stage, who carried her while she performed.

The 2002 festival included several top-tier international acts, including Pink, Shaggy, Natalie Imbruglia and the Sugababes.

Remember this? Sophie was part of girl band Bardot from 2000 to 2002

Throughout her nearly 20-year career, the singer-turned-model-turned-actress has constantly changed her appearance as she climbed the ladder of success.

Despite looking markedly different than she does today, Sophie's down-to-earth charm and 'bogan' accent makes her instantly identifiable in her 1999 casting video for Popstars.

Love Island Australia continues Wednesday at 8:40pm on Channel Nine
description: Sophie Monk is a familiar face on Australian TV thanks to her stint as The Bachelorette and her regular hosting role on Love Island.
